text:
I was always a shy and introverted child. Growing up, I would often keep to myself, preferring to spend my time alone playing with my toys or reading books. I never felt the need to be the center of attention or be surrounded by a lot of people. 

Instead, I focused on learning and exploring my own personal interests. I was very open to new experiences and ideas, and I enjoyed reading about different subjects and cultures. I was also very creative, often inventing stories and writing my own poems. 

My parents were supportive of my creative pursuits, but I was also encouraged to work hard in school. I was conscientious about my studies and strived to do my best in all my classes. As I got older, I developed a strong work ethic that I still carry with me today. 

While I was quite driven and focused on my studies, I was also prone to worry and anxiety. I was a bit of a perfectionist, and I would often become overwhelmed when I was given an assignment or task that I felt I couldn’t complete perfectly. 

I was often prone to mood swings, and my emotions could be quite intense. I had a strong imagination and a vivid inner world, which could be both a blessing and a curse. I was quite sensitive, and I often felt emotions more deeply and intensely than my peers. 

I was a bit of a loner, and I often felt like an outsider in many social situations. I preferred to hang out with just one or two close friends, as opposed to larger groups. I was kind and considerate to almost everyone, but I was often too shy to approach new people or join in conversations. 

I was also quite neurotic, and I often struggled with my mental health. I was often plagued with worries and fears, and I would obsess over the smallest of details. I was quite anxious, and I could be quite intense in my emotions. 

Despite these difficulties, I was determined to make the best of my childhood. I had an active imagination and I loved to explore the world around me. I was creative and inventive, and I was always looking for something new to discover. 

I was also quite open to new experiences and my parents often took me on trips to different places and cultures. I loved exploring new places and learning about different ways of life. 

My childhood was a time of exploration and discovery, and I cherish the memories I made. Despite my introversion, neuroses, and anxiety, I was still able to find joy in the small things and I was open to new experiences. 

I was able to find a balance between my creative pursuits, my studies, and my relationships. I learned to embrace my introversion and work through my neuroses in a healthy way. I was able to find a sense of peace, even in the midst of my worries and fears. I was, and still am, open to new experiences and ideas, and I am grateful for my childhood.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
